utter_faq/guidebook.text:
The FCSIT Academic Guidebook contains latest up to date information:
Link to guidebook: https://www.fcsit.unimas.my/images/2023/undergraduate/guidebook2023-4.pdf

utter_faq/academic_forms.text: For filling in forms or request, navigate to InAFS as the central hub for students to fill in academic forms: https://inafs.ia.unimas.my/#/login

utter_faq/registration.text:
The links to semester and course registration are:
Semester Registration: https://estudent.unimas.my/SemesterRegistration/
Course Registration: https://smpweb.unimas.my/CourseRegistration/

utter_faq/academic_calender.text: Here is the direct link to the academic calendar: https://www.bpps.unimas.my/academic-calendar. You’ll find all the important dates there.
To find the academic calendar, visit https://www.bpps.unimas.my/academic-calendar. It has all the information you need about semester dates, holidays, and exam periods.
You can find the academic calendar on the university's official website. Just go to https://www.bpps.unimas.my/academic-calendar to see all the important dates.

utter_faq/course_timetable.text:
To view your course timetable and location of your classes, log in to https://smpweb.unimas.my/eStudent/ -> Schedule -> Class Schedule
Alternatively, you can open your UNIMAS Now App -> click on second tab of the menu -> Timetable

utter_faq/facilities.text: Information regarding facilities and lab rooms in FCSIT are available here: https://www.fcsit.unimas.my/my-fcsit/facilities.
You can find details about the facilities and lab rooms in FCSIT at this link: https://www.fcsit.unimas.my/my-fcsit/facilities.

utter_faq/firstclass.text:
CGPA for First Class Honours is around 3.75
While GPA for Dean List award will be 3.5

utter_faq/lecturer.text:
- Information regarding lecturers of the faculty can be found here: https://www.fcsit.unimas.my/home/people
- Lecturer's office location can be located at academic guidebook page 8 - 20 : https://www.fcsit.unimas.my/images/2023/undergraduate/guidebook2023-4.pdf

utter_faq/evaluation.text: Course evaluation form can be filled from this link: https://sppweb.unimas.my/myform/evaluation

utter_faq/results.text: You can check your semester results and grades here: https://smpweb.unimas.my/eStudent/academicinfo/result.
To see your grades for the semester, visit this link: https://smpweb.unimas.my/eStudent/academicinfo/result.
Your semester results and grades are available at this link: https://smpweb.unimas.my/eStudent/academicinfo/result.

utter_faq/date_register.text: The opening and closing date for semester and course registration can be found posted here: https://www.bpps.unimas.my/important-news

utter_faq/academic_advisor.text: Your academic advisor information can be found at: https://smpweb.unimas.my/eStudent/academicinfo/advisor

utter_faq/exam_slip.text:
Examination slip can be accessed through this link: https://smpweb.unimas.my/eStudent/print/examslip
But several steps have to be done before exam slip can be printed:
- Contact and meet your academic advisor
- Complete your course evaluation

utter_faq/assessment.text:
A course’s assessment is typically structured using a 60:40 or 70:30 split between Continuous Assessment(s), CA, and Final Assessment(s), FA.

- CAs are usually carried out continuously through evaluations (written / oral), assignments and other forms of course work.
- FAs are typically in the form of a paper-based exam.
- Students must pass both CA and FA.
- Students will be prevented from taking an exam for a course if he or she does not meet the attendance requirements (usually 80% or above) to teaching and
  learning activities set by the University; or does not a final
  examination slip.

utter_faq/re-assessment.text:
- Students are allowed to submit a formal appeal for their Final
  Assessments’ total mark. The final assessment(s) will be re-graded
  by a third party.
- Qualified students¹ may sit for Penilaian Ulangan Khas (PUK). The
  PUK exam replaces the Final Assessment component of the total
  mark.
- The third option is to repeat a course. Please consult your
  Programme Coordinator on course availability for a particular
  semester.

utter_faq/grading.text:
The grade and grade point respectively, effective 2015/2016 cohort onwards:

 Grade   Range   Grade Point   Classification
-  A     80-100       4.00          Excellent
-  B     75-79        3.67          Excellent
-  A     70-74        3.33          Credit
-  B     65-69        3.00          Credit
-  A     60-64        2.67          Pass
-  B     55-59        2.33          Pass
